dialogue: I need you to cloudwash our software.
Move some of its functions onto the internet. But call the internet a cloud.
No one will take us seriously unless we're doing something in the cloud.
Will people take us seriously if we make technology decisions based on jargon?
We don't care what smart people think. There aren't that many of them.
We only need to convince our dumb customers.
Do you believe I moved our software to the cloud yesterday?
